title: SB 1325
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The Health and Safety Code is amended to require the department to review and approve plans that comply with regulations for interim status facilities within 60 days, or immediately if necessary for public health or safety. The department must impose hazardous waste facility postclosure plan requirements on owners or operators through enforcement orders, agreements, or permits, subject to Section 25204.5. Plans must comply with the California Environmental Quality Act and involve public input before approval or modification. The department determines significant modifications for hazardous waste facilities permits based on class 3 criteria in regulations. Public concern and complexity also factor into the decision. The department retains authority to take immediate action for public health and safety. If the department imposes a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan through an enforcement order or agreement, the owner must pay specified fees and may face enforcement actions for violations. The department may require corrective action to protect health and the environment, assess penalties for violations, and issue postclosure permits for hazardous waste facilities. Regulations for postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by January 1, 2018. The department has the authority to order necessary actions at a facility to protect public health, safety, or the environment. Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to require the department to review and approve plans submitted, ensuring compliance with regulations and state/federal laws. Immediate plan approval may be granted if necessary for public health, safety, or environmental protection. The department can take action under Section 25204.5. Hazardous waste facility postclosure plans must be imposed on owners/operators in compliance with the California Environmental Quality Act. Public involvement is required before plan approval or modification. The department can determine significant modifications for hazardous waste facilities permits based on class 3 permit modification criteria. Public concern and complexity of the proposed change are considered in this determination. The department retains authority to order actions for public health and safety at facilities. If the department imposes a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan through an enforcement order or agreement, the owner must enter a cost reimbursement agreement and pay the required fee. The department can enforce the plan by filing an injunction or requiring corrective actions for human health and environmental protection. The department can impose postclosure plan requirements through an enforcement order or agreement, and may issue a postclosure permit if necessary for enforcement. This does not limit the department's authority to order actions for public health or environmental protection. Regulations for postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by January 1, 2018. Section 1.5 of the bill includes amendments to Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code, contingent on the enactment of Assembly Bill 1611 or Senate Bill 839 by January 1, 2017. If this bill is enacted last, the amended Section 25247 will only be operative until the effective date of this bill.
